titleStmt.title: The castell of courtesie whereunto is adioyned the holde of humilitie: with the chariot of chastitie thereunto annexed. Also a dialogue betwéene age and youth, and other matters herein conteined. By Iames Yates seruingman. 1582.
titleStmt.author: Yates, James, servingman.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A15817 of text S111810 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 26079). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 242 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 87 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The castell of courtesie whereunto is adioyned the holde of humilitie: with the chariot of chastitie thereunto annexed. Also a dialogue betwéene age and youth, and other matters herein conteined. By Iames Yates seruingman. 1582.
titleStmt.author: Yates, James, servingman.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Iohn Wolfe, dwelling in Distaffe Lane, neere vnto the signe of the Castle,

notesStmt.note: "The hould of humilitie" has separate title page, foliation, and register. "The chariot of chastitie" has separate dated title page; foliation and register are continuous.
This state of quire ² A outer forme has sub title page to "The hould of humilitie" with "seruingman" in line 5.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
